Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Justice when he intends to have published or made available submissions made in the context of developing the Whitaker report, which were not submitted on the basis of absolute confidentiality; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Justice (Mr. Dukes) Alan Dukes
Speaker.P: I refer the Deputy to the answer to Question No. 233 of 12 November last (vol. 361 No. 8 col. 1865) in which it was indicated that, apart from the fact that it was not clear that certain submissions apparently regarded by the Committee of Inquiry into the Penal System as being “non-confidential” would, in fact, be so regarded by their authors, other issues arose which would have to be considered. Consideration of these issues is continuing and I am arranging to have a number of individuals and organisations who made submissions to the committee approached in order to ascertain their views on the committee's suggestion that these submissions be deposited in various libraries.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. G. Collins Mr. G. Collins
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Justice if he will make a statement on the condition of a person (details supplied) in County Limerick who is on hunger strike in Limerick Prison; and if he will confirm that the appropriate medical aid and advice is available to this man.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Justice (Mr. Dukes) Alan Dukes
Speaker.P: The person concerned who was in custody for contempt of court was released from custody on 5 June, having purged his contempt. I am satisfied that appropriate medical aid and advice was available at all times.

Speaker.hpid: Dr. Ormonde Dr. Ormonde
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the present position regarding the extension to Glenbeg national school; and when it will be sanctioned and allowed to go to tender.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: My Department in January 1986 sanctioned a grant for an extension to Glenbeg national school, County Waterford. Contract documents for the project are now in course of preparation in my Department. When this work has been completed the question of inviting tenders for the project will arise for consideration. It is not possible, at this stage, to provide a time-scale for further developments.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Galway Teacher Appointment.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. F. Foley Mr. F. Foley
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if he is aware of an increase in the number of pupils at Ballyturn national school, County Galway, since last Easter; and if he will authorise the school's management board to appoint a second teacher from October 1986.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: In order to warrant the appointment of a second teacher from October 1986 an average enrolment of 33 would need to be secured for the two quarters ended 30 June and 30 September 1986. The average enrolment for the quarter ended 31 March 1986 was 28.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. S. Byrne Mr. S. Byrne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education when work will commence at the new vocational school in Cahir, County Tipperary; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: Planning of a new vocational school at Cahir, County Tipperary, has reached stage 2 i.e. outline sketch scheme.

My Department recently requested Tipperary (South Riding) VEC to investigate certain cost implications associated with the development of the site. It is not possible to say at this early stage of planning when building will be commenced.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Kildare Recreational Amenities.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Durkan Mr. Durkan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the total amount of funds allocated for the provision of recreational amenities in County Kildare; the amount of funding in each case; the purpose for which the funds were allocated; and the name of the scheme.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: My Department operates a capital grant scheme for the provision of recreational facilities which provides grant-aid to enable voluntary community organisations to employ building contractors on the provision of community and recreational facilities.
The following projects in County Kildare have been allocated grants in the past:—

row.entry: Provision of sports complex at Newbridge

MainHeading.P: Applications for grant-aid in 1986 including a number from organisations in County Kildare are under consideration at present and I hope to be in a position to announce a decision on these applications shortly.

I must point out however, that a total sum of £1.2 million is available in 1986 to meet existing commitments and for allocation to new projects under this scheme. A large number of grant approvals in 1985 have involved the carry-over of heavy commitments to 1986 and because of this it will be possible to assist only a small number of new projects this year.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Durkan Mr. Durkan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the current position with regard to the provision of (a) secondary school facilities and (b) primary school facilities in County Kildare; the total number of schools extended or built since 1981; the names of the schools; if he will give a description of the facilities and the cost in each case; and his proposals for school building and extensions for (a) and (b) as projected at the present time.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: The comprehensive information sought by the Deputy in regard to the provision of secondary and primary school facilities in County Kildare is not readily available in my Department, and the compilation of such information would involve the expenditure of an inordinate amount of official time. In the circumstances I am not in a position to give the information requested. If the Deputy put down a question seeking information about progress in relation to a particular school building project, the information would be given.

Speaker.hpid: Dr. O'Hanlon Dr. O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if, in view of the serious overcrowding at Oram school, he will expedite the erection of an extra classroom at the school; and if it will be ready for use in September.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: On 19 May 1986, my Department's professional advisers forwarded the necessary documents to the school authorities to enable them to apply for planning permission and to seek quotations for the provision of a pre-fabricated classroom at Oram national school, County Monaghan. Whenever a suitable quotation and planning permission have been forwarded to my Department, the school authorities will be authorised promptly to proceed with the provision of the extra classroom.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. S. Brennan Mr. S. Brennan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if it is Government policy not to replace the present school bus fleet; the alternative arrangements which will be made; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: It is not Government policy not to replace the school bus fleet. No decision has been taken in this regard.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Browne Mr. Browne
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if he will arrange to have a mature student grant sanctioned for a person (details supplied) in County Wexford who is attending St. Patrick's Training College, Drumcondra.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: The application is under active consideration in my Department at present, and I hope to be in a position shortly to communicate my decision to the Deputy.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Yates Mr. Yates
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education when a facelift grant application made on behalf of a youth organisation (details supplied) in County Wexford will be approved; and, if so, the rate at which payment will be made.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: I hope to be in a position to give a decision shortly on the grant application referred to in the question. I must point out however, that, because the resources available for the Department's capital grants scheme are insufficient to meet demands and because of the heavy commitments carried forward from 1985, it will be possible to assist only a small number of new projects in 1986.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. N. Treacy Mr. N. Treacy
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education the up-to-date position in relation to the erection of a new school (details supplied) in County Galway; the present stage of this school building; the date on which it arrived at this stage; if money has been included in the 1986 Estimates for the building of this school; when he expects the building to commence; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney) Minister for Education (Mr. Cooney)
Speaker.P: Following the acquisition by the school authorities in March 1986 of a site, my Department requested its professional staff to undertake a feasibility study in relation to the proposed new school building referred to in County Galway. As the project is at an early stage of development the question of making an allocation for it in the current year's estimates did not arise. MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - AnCO Schemes.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Durkan Mr. Durkan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour the total amount of funding allocated from 1981 to date under the various AnCO schemes in County Kildare; the amount of funding; the name of the scheme in each case; the total amount of funding allocated by the Youth Employment Agency for the same period in County Kildare; the name of the scheme; the purpose for which the funds were allocated; and the amount of funding in each case.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. Quinn) Ruairí Quinn
Speaker.P: The total amount of funds allocated under AnCO schemes from 1981 to date in County Kildare is as follows:

MainHeading.P: To date £136,610 has been allocated to County Kildare by the Youth Employment Agency under the community enterprise programme.
Apart from the community enterprise programme most of the funding provided by the Youth Employment Agency is allocated to national programmes administered by other bodies. Among these programmes are:
—ACOT's certificate in farming on which there were 71 participants from County Kildare at the end of 1985;
—the youth self-employment programme under which 18 young people from County Kildare had received guaranteed loans by the end of 1985;
—specialist employment subsidy schemes in marketing, overseas marketing and science and technology under which seven young people were working with firms in County Kildare in 1985.

It is estimated that at least £130,000 was provided in funding to County Kildare since the establishment of the Youth Employment Agency on these programmes, in addition to the funds allocated under the community enterprise programme.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Durkan Mr. Durkan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour the proposed expenditure in County Kildare under the social employment scheme in the current year; the number of people employed under the scheme; and the location of such employees in each case.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. Quinn) Ruairí Quinn
Speaker.P: At present, statistics in relation to the social employment scheme are compiled on the basis of National Manpower Service regions. It will not be possible to supply information regarding numbers employed or location of schemes on a county basis until the computerisation of the scheme, which is currently underway, is complete.

In the east region of the NMS which encompasses Counties Dublin, Kildare, Meath and Wicklow there are currently 1684 persons employed on 638 projects. In 1986 to date, a total of £2.4 million has been spent in the east region of SES projects.

Speaker.hpid: Dr. O'Hanlon Dr. O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour the number of social employment schemes in operation in counties Monaghan and Cavan; the location of each scheme; the total amount of moneys allocated; and the total number of individuals employed.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. Quinn) Ruairí Quinn
Speaker.P: At present information relating to the social employment scheme is complied on the basis of National Manpower Service regions. It will not be possible to supply information relating to numbers employed or location of projects on a county basis until the computerisation of the scheme, which is currently underway, is complete.
In the north-east region of the NMS which encompasses Louth, Cavan and Monaghan there are 134 projects currently operating which provide employment for 808 persons.
In 1986 a total of £1.3 million has been spent to date on SES projects operating in the north-east region of the NMS.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Nolan Mr. Nolan
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour when payment will be made to a person (details supplied) in County Carlow, as a result of a redundancy claim as he is currently awaiting the payment of the balance of redundacy moneys holiday pay and pay in lieu of notice.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. Quinn) Ruairí Quinn
Speaker.P: The employee concerned was paid a statutory redundancy lump sum of £643.70 by my Department from the redundancy and employers' insolvency fund on 9 October 1985. This was the equivalent of five week's gross pay calculated in accordance with the provisions of the Redundancy Payments Acts 1967 to 1984, and based on the information supplied by the reciever of the company in which the person was employed concerning his age, service and normal weekly pay. My Department is not aware of any balance of redundancy lump sum due in this case.

So far as other payments to the employee are concerned, an application under the Protection of Employees (Employers' Insolvency) Act, 1984 has been received from the receiver of the company for funds to pay minimum notice awards and holiday pay entitlements to former employees including the person named by the Deputy. My Department has been in correspondence with the receiver for clarification of the application which is expected to be received within the next few days. This should enable my Department to make an early payment to the receiver for disbursement to the former employees of the company in respect of their minimum notice awards and outstanding holiday pay.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Prendergast Mr. Prendergast
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour if the present payment for those employed on social employment schemes will be adjusted in line with the proposed increases in social welare payments due to take effect from July; and if he will issue a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. Quinn) Ruairí Quinn
Speaker.P: Following a recent Government decision in relation to the social employment scheme, it was decided to increase the weekly payments to SES participants with an adult dependant, from £70 to £85. This increase took effect from 1 May 1986. I am not contemplating making any further changes at the moment. However, I will keep all aspects of the scheme, including the wages payable, under review.

I might add that SES wages are in respect of a 40 hour fortnight. They are higher than social welfare payments for many persons on the live register. The scheme has already achieved its target of 10,000 participants for 1986.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Leonard Mr. J. Leonard
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour the number of persons employed by local authorities under the social employment scheme who are aged (a) over 25 years, and (b) under 25 years.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. Quinn) Ruairí Quinn
Speaker.P: Information of the sort sought by the Deputy is not readily available and would take some time to produce. However, a recent survey of a sample of SES participants indicated that approximately 3 per cent of the total were under 25.
Approximately 70 per cent of the 10,000 persons currently employed on social employment scheme projects are employed by local authorities.
The Deputy will be aware that the rules of the social employment scheme provide that in particular circumstances, up to 10 per cent of participants on any given projects may be under 25.

Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour the progress that has been made on the application for payment of entitlements under the Protection of Employees (Employers' Insolvency) Act, 1984, made by a person (details supplied) in County Carlow; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. Aylward Mr. Aylward
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Labour the progress that has been made on the application for payment of entitlements under the Protection of Employees (Employers' Insolvency) Act, 1984, made by a person (details supplied) in County Carlow; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Labour (Mr. Quinn) Ruairí Quinn
Speaker.P: I propose to take Question Nos. 177 to 179, inclusive, together.

As I indicated to the Deputy in my reply to a question by him on 15 April 1986 my Department had received applications through the liquidator of the company, for payment under the Protection of Employees (Employers' Insolvency) Act, 1984, of awards by the Employment Appeals Tribunal to two of the employees concerned. As, however, the tribunal, in its decision of 14 January 1986 had not broken down the amounts of the awards in respect of the two employees as between the Redundancy Payments Acts, the Minimum Notice and Terms of Employment Act and the Unfair Dismissals Act, which is necessary before any payment can be made from the redundancy and employers' insolvency fund, the two applications received were being referred to the tribunal for clarification of the details of the awards. These references have since been made and I understand that the tribunal will shortly be in touch with the parties to arrange a hearing of the cases.

MainHeading.P: If the third employee concerned — the person involved in Question No. 179 makes an application to my Department, through the liquidator of the company for payment under the Protection of Employees (Employers' Insolvency) Act, 1984, I will have his application also referred to the tribunal for clarification so as to enable payment to be made. I have arranged for my Department to forward the necessary application form to the person concerned.
